creator: AIO Mobile Apps
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons, many animation effects and a variety of themes. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change the font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.
descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Apps menu now has 4 different styles: Classic, Sortable, Alphabet, Categories
* Frequent apps widget can be swiped to switch between categories
* Option to enable category signs in app buttons and icons
* My Apps widget can be automatically filled with applications of a certain category by tapping on it while it is empty
* There is an option to change the category in the long tap application editing menu

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.
descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Apps menu now has 4 different styles: Classic, Sortable, Alphabet, Categories
* Frequent apps widget can be swiped to switch between categories
* Option to enable category signs in app buttons and icons
* My Apps widget can be automatically filled with applications of a certain category by tapping on it while it is empty
* There is an option to change the category in the long tap application editing menu

title: AIO Launcher

creator: AIO Mobile Apps
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons, many animation effects and a variety of themes. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change the font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.
descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

* Option to add newly installed apps to search history

title: AIO Launcher

creator: AIO Mobile Apps
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons, many animation effects and a variety of themes. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change the font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change the font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

* Increased apps menu swipe sensitivity
* Greek translation (thanks to Dionisis Nikolopoulos)
* Updated France translation

title: AIO Launcher

creator: AIO Mobile Apps
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons, many animation effects and a variety of themes. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher
descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Launcher commands in the search results
* Mail dialog title can be expanded by tap
* Notification reply dialog now includes notification text
* Apps menu can be opened via home button
* Increased apps menu swipe sensitivity
* Fixed News widget
* Greek translation (thanks to Dionisis Nikolopoulos)
* Updated France translation

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Android 11 full support
* Screen time indicator in the Monitor widget (Android 9+)
* Tasks widget now has context menu to add hours, days and weeks to tasks
* Option to enable private mode for third-party widgets
* Option to auto-hide Alarm widget
* Better way to change themes from the main screen
* Settings screen now changes theme based on the day/night settings

* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher

* Ability to change audio records names and colors via long press
* Ability to change note color via long press
* Ability to move app from the Frequent apps widget
* "StartPage" search engine support
* Indonesian translation (thanks to Erick Heradi)
* Bug fixes

title: AIO Launcher

creator: AIO Mobile Apps
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons, many animation effects and a variety of themes. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher
descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Contacts birthdays in the Calendar widget
* Search contacts by organization
* Full Android for Work support for shortcuts
* Tasker commands for create notes and tasks in background (https://aiolauncher.app/api.html)
* Icons rendering optimizations

* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* New UI theme: Cards
* Ability to fold/unfold widgets without titles (by tapping on the top right corner)
* Option to change the background color of widgets for Modern and Cards themes
* Native support for DuckDuckGo bangs in the search screen (type "!gp aio" or "@gp aio" to search on Google Play, more info https:// 'duckduckgo.com/bang)
* When widget headers are turned off, bars are now shown. You can disable them in the UI settings.

* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* Any widget can be disabled in settings;
* You can minimize the widget by clicking on its name;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-hk/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
Meet the new big feature of the AIO Launcher: scripts. With the help of scripts, anyone can create widget of their dreams. The new version already includes more than ten different scripts, even more you can download from the official website. In addition, the new version includes:

* Ability to add widgets from the side menu;
* A lot of improvements to the search screen;
* A lot of minor tweaks and fixes.

* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to connect to Outlook:

1. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12409/microsoft-account-app-passwords-two-step-verification
2. https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/pop-imap-and-smtp-settings-for-outlook-com-d088b986-291d-42b8-9564-9c414e2aa040

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;

* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;

* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;

* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;

* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

* Several different themes;

* Multiple icon shapes;

* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

title: AIO Launcher

creator: AIO Mobile Apps
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons and many animation effects. It does not collect personal information. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

Telegram: @aio_launcher

title: AIO Launcher

creator: AIO Mobile Apps
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons and many animation effects. It does not collect personal information. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

AIO Launcher uses the Accessibility Service to perform actions such as turning off the screen, taking a screenshot, and displaying the screen of recent apps.

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher

descriptionHtml:

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

AIO Launcher uses the Accessibility Service to perform actions such as turning off the screen, taking a screenshot, and displaying the screen of recent apps.

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher
descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Adaptive and dynamic icon packs support
* Automatic conversion of legacy icons into adaptive (can be disabled in the settings)
* Ability to reassign "swipe to the right" action
* More accurate foldable devices support

Make love, not war.

* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Twitter - all tweets or a single user tweets;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

AIO Launcher uses the Accessibility Service to perform actions such as turning off the screen, taking a screenshot, and displaying the screen of recent apps.

Telegram: @aio_launcher

* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
* Side menu scripting capability
* Scripting API has been significantly expanded
* Scripts for displaying tasks, calendar and contacts in the side menu included
* The side menu now remembers the menu style and selected category between style switches
* Weekly calendar widget: added option to disable weather
* Added option to select very large font and icon size
* Tasker API now can send broadcasts messages
* Twitter widget removed due to new service restrictions

title: AIO Launcher

creator: AIO Mobile Soft
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher is not ordinary home screen. It does not have colorful icons and many animation effects. It does not collect personal information. Instead, AIO Launcher uses a screen space to show you the most important information.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

title:
AIO Launcher
4.9.3

creator: AIO Mobile Soft
descriptionHtml:
Enhance your smartphone's functionality with AIO Launcher. Experience a sleek, minimalist interface that efficiently displays crucial information without unnecessary embellishments. AIO Launcher prioritizes privacy and security, offering a sophisticated and streamlined user experience.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

AIO Launcher uses the Accessibility Service to perform actions such as turning off the screen, taking a screenshot, and displaying the screen of recent apps.

Telegram: @aio_launcher

title:
AIO Launcher
5.0.0

creator: AIO Mobile Soft
descriptionHtml:
Enhance your smartphone's functionality with AIO Launcher. Experience a sleek, minimalist interface that efficiently displays crucial information without unnecessary embellishments. AIO Launcher prioritizes privacy and security, offering a sophisticated and streamlined user experience.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

AIO Launcher uses the Accessibility Service to perform actions such as turning off the screen, taking a screenshot, and displaying the screen of recent apps.

Telegram: @aio_launcher

descriptionHtml:
Enhance your smartphone's functionality with AIO Launcher. Experience a sleek, minimalist interface that efficiently displays crucial information without unnecessary embellishments. AIO Launcher prioritizes privacy and security, offering a sophisticated and streamlined user experience.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

title:

5.4.2

creator: AIO Mobile Soft
descriptionHtml:
Enhance your smartphone's functionality with AIO Launcher. Experience a sleek, minimalist interface that efficiently displays crucial information without unnecessary embellishments. AIO Launcher prioritizes privacy and security, offering a sophisticated and streamlined user experience.

AIO Launcher can display the following information on the screen:

* Weather - current weather and forecast for 10 days;
* Notifications - standard android notifications;
* Dialogs - your messenger conversations;
* Player - when you turn on the music, playback control buttons appear;
* Frequent apps - frequently used applications buttons;
* Your apps - the icons of the selected applications;
* Contacts - quick contacts;
* Dialer - numpad for quick calls;
* Timer - timer start buttons;
* Mail - list of received emails;
* Notes - list of your notes;
* Tasks - list of tasks;
* Telegram - last messages (paid);
* RSS - latest news;
* Calendar - upcoming events in the calendar;
* Exchange rates - currency exchange rates;
* Bitcoin - the bitcoin price;
* Finance - stocks, precious metals, cryptocurrencies etc (paid);
* Calculator - simple calculator;
* Audio Recorder - record, play and share audio;
* System monitor - RAM and NAND usage, percentage of battery power;
* Control panel - toggles for WiFi/BT/GPS etc;
* Traffic - shows current download/upload rates and connection type;
* Android widget - standard app widgets (paid).

Other features:

* Several different themes;
* Icon packs support;
* Multiple icon shapes;
* Ability to change font size;
* Advanced search system for applications, contacts, files and information on the Internet;
* Ability to rename applications;
* Widgets and plugins support;
* Tasker integration;
* Gestures;
* Very customizable;
* ChatGPT integration.

Usage:
* Swipe on search button opens quick menu with phone, camera and market;
* To add the Android widget, long press search button and select the "+" icon;
* To resize the widget, hold the finger on the widget, then use the up and down buttons;
* To access the list of all applications, drag from the left edge of the screen;
* Hold finger on various elements of the screen to open menu;
* To open settings, hold your finger on the search button, and then click the gear icon;
* Hold the title of the widget to move it around;
* You can minimize/maximize the widget by clicking on its name;
* If the title are disabled, the widget can be minimized by clicking in the upper right corner of the widget;
* To remove an application, open the application menu, hold your finger on the desired application, and drag it to the recycle bin icon.

How to set as default launcher on a Huawei smartphone:

Settings - Applications - Settings - Default applications - Settings - Manager - AIO Launcher

If notification widget don't work on MIUI:

Settings - Battery & performance - Manage apps' battery usage - Choose apps - AIO Launcher - No restrictions

If app widgets don't work on MIUI or you can't open notification via built-in Notifications widget:

Go to the application settings on your phone, find the application that owns the widget, click "Other permissions" and enable "Display pop-ups when running in the background" option.

If the application restarts every time you return to the desktop - add the launcher to the power saving mode exceptions (you can read how to do this here: https://dontkillmyapp.com).

This app uses the Device Administrator permission.

AIO Launcher uses the Accessibility Service to perform actions such as turning off the screen, taking a screenshot, and displaying the screen of recent apps.

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher

title:
AIO Launcher
5.6.6

creator: AIO Mobile Soft
descriptionHtml:
AIO Launcher — a home screen that helps, not distracts

AIO Launcher isn’t just a home screen — it’s a powerful tool for those who want to use their phone more efficiently. A minimalist, fast, and thoughtful interface that shows only what matters and helps you save time.

Why AIO is better:

- Information, not icons. A screen full of useful data instead of a grid of apps.
- Flexible and customizable. Make it your own in just a few minutes.
- Fast and lightweight. No unnecessary animations or slowdowns.
- Private and secure. No tracking, ever.

What AIO Launcher can do:

- 30+ built-in widgets: Weather, notifications, messengers, tasks, finance, and much more.
- Tasker integration and Lua scripting for automating your daily routines.
- Built-in ChatGPT integration — smart replies, automation, and assistance with zero effort.
- Powerful search: Look through the web, apps, contacts, widgets — all in one place.

One developer. More focus. Maximum speed.

I build AIO Launcher alone, and it’s my top priority. Bugs happen, but I fix them faster than big companies reply to emails. If something goes wrong — just reach out and I’ll take care of it.

Not for everyone

AIO Launcher isn’t about pretty wallpapers and animations. It’s a tool for those who want to move faster, manage their information, and stay productive. If you value efficiency — you’re in the right place.

Device Admin and Accessibility usage

AIO Launcher uses Device Administrator permission to make tasks like turning off the screen or taking screenshots more convenient.

It also uses the Accessibility Service to handle gestures and simplify device interaction.

Feedback and support

Email: zobnin@gmail.com
Telegram: @aio_launcher
descriptionShort: All you need on a single home screen

appDetails.recentChangesHtml:
- A clear and simple guide added: AIO in Five Minutes
- Completely rewritten badge system
- Smarter algorithm for sorting frequent apps
- Optimized script loading
- Bug fixes
